title: Depeche Mode - L12BONG39 - Martyr (2006)
description:
Artist: Depeche Mode
Single: Martyr
Label: Mute
Catalog #: L12BONG39
Country: EU
Format: 2x12"
Release year: 2006
EAN code: 0094637508619
Matrix:
PL12BONG39 A-2 SIMON - THE EXCHANGE
PL12BONG39 B-2 SIMON - THE EXCHANGE
PL12BONG39 C-2 SIMON - THE EXCHANGE
PL12BONG39 D-2 SIMON - THE EXCHANGE
FYI, The Exchange is the studio, where mastering was done, and Simon is engineer who did it: http://www.exchangemastering.co.uk/simon.html
Equipment:
Turntable: Music Hall MMF-5 with Goldring 1012GX (default) cartridge
Preamp: dunno, something in my receiver :)
Soundcard: Creative SoundBlaster Audigy SE
Software: Linux with latest ALSA drivers for soundcard, Audacity for mastering.
It was ripped from mint record on the first play.
Grabbed in 96 kHz 32bit (really it's 24bit (i hope) converted to 32bit), then normalized, then downsampled to 48 kHz, then converted to 16bit.
If you want to burn these files on CD, you would need to resample them to 44.1 kHz.
I used 48 kHz for 2 reasons - more exact downsampling from 96 kHz and audio won't be resampled when played on computer - most of the modern audiocards don't support 44.1 kHz output, but i think almost all can play 48 kHz audio.
Don't ask me why i grab it in 96 kHz :) It's software bug. Anyway, I'd like to think that having done lowpass filtering digitally could be better than having done none.
CD versions of these tracks are awfully mastered, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loudness_war
Anyway it sounds great for me, and it has no clipping, so sound should be better than from CD version.
Photos of cover and labels are included.
Released by parafin.

Tracklist:
01-Personal Jesus (Boyz Noize Rework).flac
02-Never Let Me Down Again (Digitalism Remix).flac
03-Everything Counts (Oliver Huntemann & Stephan Bodzin Dub).flac
04-People Are People (Underground Resistance Remix).flac
